601 Oswald Tower, University Park, PA 16802
EMPLOYMENT
August 2014-
M.A.
B.A.
EDUCATION
Ph.D.
National Institute of Child Health and Human Development Postdoctoral Fellow,
Population Research Institute, Pennsylvania State University
University of Texas at Austin, Sociology, 2014
(Dissertation: “Three Essays on the Social and Temporal Dimensions of Cardiovascular
Health among the Mexican-origin Population in the United States.” Chair: Robert A.
Hummer)
University of Florida, Latin American Studies, 2008
(Thesis: “Language and Earnings of Latinos in Florida.” Chair: Charles H. Wood)
Pennsylvania State University, Spanish and English, 2004
Minor: International Studies
PEER-REVIEWED PUBLICATIONS
Marteleto, Leticia J. and Molly Dondero. 2013. “Maternal Age at First Birth and Adolescent
Education in Brazil.” Demographic Research. 28:793-820.
Callahan, Rebecca M. and Chandra Muller with Molly Dondero. 2013. "Immigration, U.S. Schools,
and the Changing Youth Vote." Chapter 1 in Coming of Political Age: American Schools and the
Civic Development of Immigrant Youth by Rebecca M. Callahan and Chandra Muller. Russell Sage
Foundation: New York, NY.
Dondero, Molly and Chandra Muller. 2012. “School Stratification in New and Established Latino
Destinations.” Social Forces. 91(2):477-502.
MANUSCRIPTS UNDER REVIEW AND IN PROGRESS
Dondero, Molly and Jennifer Van Hook. “Generational Status, Neighborhood Contexts, and
Mother-Child Resemblance in Dietary Quality in Mexican-origin Families.” Revise and resubmit,
Social Science and Medicine
Marteleto, Leticia J. and Molly Dondero. “Racial Inequality in Education in Brazil: A Twins Fixed
Effects Approach.” Revise and resubmit, Demography
Dondero, Molly. “Do Mexican Immigrants Experience Segmented Health Assimilation? An
Analysis of the Relationship Between Education, Acculturation, and Cardiovascular Health.”
Dondero Curriculum Vitae
Dondero, Molly, Jennifer Van Hook, Emnet Fikru, and Molly Martin. “Food Settings, Healthy
Eating, and Dietary Acculturation among Mexican-origin Youth.”
Dondero, Molly. “Age, Period, and Cohort Trends in Obesity among Mexican-origin Adults in the
United States.”
Dondero, Molly, Hummer, Robert A. Luis Rosero-Bixby, and William H. Dow. “Education
Gradients in Older Adult Cardiovascular Health: A Comparison Between Mexico and Costa Rica.”
Dondero, Molly and Melissa Humphries. “The College Savings Behavior of Foreign-born Parents in
the United States.” Under review
Frisco, Michelle L., Erin M. Baumgartner, Jennifer Van Hook, and Molly Dondero. “Educational
Contexts and Outcomes of Latino First Graders in New and Established Latino Destinations.” Under
review
RESEARCH AND TEACHING INTERESTS
Social demography, medical sociology, health disparities, international migration, immigrant
incorporation, race/ethnicity, inequality, Latin America, United States
GRANTS AND FELLOWSHIPS
National Institute of Child Health and Human Development Postdoctoral
Fellowship, Population Research Institute, Pennsylvania State University
National Institute of Child Health and Human Development Predoctoral
Traineeship, Population Research Center, University of Texas at Austin

Florida,” Center for Latin American Studies, University of Florida ($1,500)
Foreign Language and Area Studies (FLAS) Academic Year Fellowship for
Portuguese, University of Florida
Fulbright U.S. Student Grant, Argentina

Pennsylvania State University
Dondero Curriculum Vitae
CONFERENCE PRESENTATIONS
Dondero, Molly and Jennifer Van Hook. “Generational Status, Neighborhood
Contexts, and Mother-Child Resemblance in Dietary Quality in Mexican-origin
Families.” Paper to be presented at the Annual Meeting of the American
Sociological Association, Chicago, IL, August 22-25 and at the Federal Statistical
Research Data Center Annual Conference, Stanford, CA, September 18
Hummer, Robert A., Molly Dondero, Luis Rosero-Bixby, and William H.
Dow.“Education Gradients in Older Adult Cardiovascular Health: A Comparison
Between Mexico and Costa Rica.” Paper presented at the Annual Meeting of the
Population Association of America, Boston, MA, May 1-3
Marteleto, Leticia and Dondero, Molly. “Racial Inequality in Education in Brazil:
A Twins Fixed Effects Approach.” Paper presented at the Annual Meeting of the
Population Association of America, Boston, MA, May 1-3
Dondero, Molly and Melissa Humphries. “The College Savings Behavior of
Foreign-born Parents in the United States.” Paper presented at the Annual
Meeting of the American Sociological Association, New York, NY, August 10-13
Dondero, Molly and Melissa Humphries. “The College Savings Behavior of
Foreign-born Parents in the United States.” Paper presented at the Annual
Meeting of the Population Association of America, San Francisco, CA, May 2-5
Marteleto, Leticia J. and Molly Dondero. “The Role of Mother’s Age at Birth for
Children's Education in the Context of Below-Replacement Fertility in Brazil,”
Paper presented at the Annual Meeting of the Population Association of America,
San Francisco, CA, May 2-5
Dondero, Molly and Chandra Muller. “School Stratification in New and
Established Latino Destinations,” Paper presented at the Annual Meeting of the
Population Association of America, Washington, D.C., March 31-April 2
Dondero, Molly. “Characteristics of Schools in New Immigrant-Receiving
Communities in the U.S.,” Poster presented at the Annual Meeting of the
Population Association of America, Dallas, April 15-17
INVITED TALKS
“Generational Status, Neighborhood Contexts, and Mother-Child Resemblance in
Dietary Quality in Mexican-origin Families.” Population Research Institute
